title: Stunning
text: This is a must see if you have any interest in history or architecture or just a love of beautiful things. It is well worth the trek up the hill and the potential crowds just to be near this magnificent example of ancient architecture and culture.

title: Smaller than Expected
text: The museum houses some incredible artefacts and is very well laid out with plenty to read about what you were looking at. It was smaller than i expected so you can get round in probably an hour and a half. Some areas you are not permitted to take photographs and staff will remind people of this. The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable as well.

title: Ancient Glory
text: I was so excited to visit the Acropolis and i must admit that it did not disappoint. Pictures do not do it justice and you really get a sense of the scale of it by seeing it up close as well as seeing it on the skyline as you approach. It is busy and the locals recommended going early or late to visit. It is quite a steep climb up so be prepared with suitable footwear. My one regret is not taking a guided tour as i feel i would have learnt so much more.

title: Comfortable, convenient and charming
text: Visited the hotel for three nights immediately following Christmas and it was perfect for our trip in so many reasons. The service upon arrival was excellent. We had encountered a problem in that a car was meant to meet us at the airport but it hadn't turned up so we had to get a taxi. The hotel arranged our transport back and reduced the price due to the inconvenience of the trip going out, the staff were apologetic, decisive and pleasant in the way they dealt with it. The room itself was comfortable and we had a good view of the Acropolis even though we weren't in the rooms classed as having and Acropolis view. The gym was conveniently located on our floor and was very good for a hotel gym. Breakfast was fabulous with a wide variety of choice of freshly cooked food and other options for all tastes, the view from the restaurant is gorgeous. The hotel is conveniently located near the hop on hop off bus stops so is ideal for getting to a variety of the major locations for a short stay in Athens. There are restaurants around the hotel so there is plenty of choice of places to eat as well. We would definitely come back!

title: Great atmosphere, service and charm.
text: This restaurant was located conveniently next to our hotel and when we had peered in at diners whilst walking around we decided it definitely looked like a place for us. The staff were fantastic, polite and quick service and whilst we personally didn't ask too much of them we could see them expertly handling large groups and customers that had a lot of enquiries. The food was well prepared and delicious and the portion sizes were more than adequate. If we had more time we would definitely have visited again.

title: A little taste of Greece!
text: I had already read the positive reviews for this restaurant before visiting as i had searched for places to eat near our hotel. I hadnt realised just how close the location was to the hotel being situated literally across the road from the front doors so not only was it conveniently located we found it to be excellent in many ways. We visited on the first night of our stay and loved the decor inside as well as the two musicians playing traditional Greek music. Choosing what to eat proved difficult because the choice was broad and seeing the food come out the dishes looked delicious. We decided to get the grill sharing platter and quite frankly it was beautiful i think i could have eaten it on my own.The staff were friendly, service was quick, drinks were nicely chilled and as said before the food was amazing, so good in fact that we returned again for our third and final night of our visit to Athens.

title: Breathtaking
text: Really enjoyed the coach trip to the Temple as got to see some beautiful coastline and some gorgeous seaside towns. Upon first seeing the temple you can understand why the location was chosen by the Ancient Greeks as a place to worship the God of the Ocean. The temple itself is very well preserved and a really good example to explore. To look around it doesn't take long but it is well worth the trip out to see it. The views over the Aegean are stunning as well and whilst our visit was a little chilly i can imagine that sunset in the warmer months must be incredible. The gift shop, cafe and toilet facilities are all well kept, reasonably priced and suitably located as you walk to the car park. This is a must see if you're staying in the area.

title: Would like to see at Christmas
text: I can imagine that this area would be perfect at Christmas, walking down them makes you feel like you're in a Dickens novel but i think with lights ablaze it would be even more impressive.

title: Lovely walk
text: Walked through the green on a very pleasant Autumn day and nearly forgot we were in the heart of England. The architecture is very grand and gives the feel of a city bigger than Bristol and it is well worth tourists taking a look.

title: Tripadvisor took us there!
text: After using Tripadviser to find restaurants near to our hotel this was the one we decided on due to the good reviews and the proximity. We were not disappointed. The food was excellent and very reasonable priced, service was both thorough and very quick and the atmosphere in the restaurant was lively but not intimidating. We were really pleased we chose this venue for our one night in Bristol.

title: Perfect Location
text: This hotel provided us with the perfect location for our weekend in Bristol. It was 10 minute walk from Temple Meads train station and then 10 minutes the other way to the centre of town and the theatre which was the main purpose of our trip. Reasonably priced, very clean and comfortable and excellent customer service we would definitely choose this hotel again if we were staying in the city.
place: Premier Inn Bristol City Centre (Finzels Reach) hotel

title: Wonderful meal, generous portions!
text: We visited this pub whilst staying over the road at the Knights Village and it is ideally situated for anyone staying there. There was a broad selection of food on the menu and drinks behind the bar and all were reasonably priced when you consider the pub could be classed as being in a tourist hotspot. When our food arrived we were both overwhelmed by the portion sizes, particularly the amount of chips that came with the burger. It was quite a busy pub but it was Friday night and the atmosphere was great.

title: An excellent stay with fantastic service.
text: Ive always been intrigued by the prospect of staying at the Knights Village as i visit the castle a couple of times a year at least for work and walk past the village. When a groupon came up i jumped at the chance. We stayed in one of the tents and like some of the other reviews have said it can get chilly at this time of the year but we had packed accordingly as suggested in the literature provided by the venue before arrival. The entertainment seemed good particularly for children and for adults their is enough to keep you occupied as well. We did not eat in the evening instead choosing to walk out to one of the local pubs. The wifi is good if you need it and the breakfast in the morning was very good. One of the highlights for us was the ability to get drinks 24 hours a day from the restaurant and if you were with a tent of 4 you could nearly get your money back just on that perk. The castle was fantastic as always and overall this was a great weekend. The customer service staff we found to be delightful and everyone who dealt with us seemed to go out of their way to make our stay perfect.

title: Impressive and immense
text: Having seen the square on TV numerous times you really dont get an idea of the scale of it and just how intricately decorated the area is. We werent lucky enough to visit on a day where the Pope addresses the crowd but i can only imagine what it must be like with that volume of individuals there to greet him. Amazing architecture.

title: Mesmerising
text: I could have stood in awe and studied this room for days, i was lucky to get a spot in the middle of the room and was able to get a sense of the work that must have gone in to creating this masterpiece. It is incredibly busy, however, and a little annoying that some ignore requests to not take photographs!

title: Wonderful but overcrowded
text: I cant give this experience any less than 5 stars on the rating as it is an incredible collection of art works and historical pieces BUT this was by far the most crowded and busiest part of our visit to Rome. In some areas the corridors were just full with tours and it was impossible to stop and look at the pieces in any kind of detail, you just felt like you were being taken along by a sea of humanity. It was also incredibly hot and as per instructions i had worn a shirt and trousers for the day so was even hotter than normal. That is not to say that what is on offer to see here is amazing and the Sistine Chapel is worth braving the hoard for in itself. Definitely invest in the skip the line tickets!

title: Beautiful but busy!
text: The steps are obviously iconic and a must see if in Rome but it was incredibly busy and what was more annoying was the hoards of gentlemen attempting to palm roses off on us, they were persistent to say the least. The architecture is impressive and it has featured in such iconic movies that it is an experience to visit but it was not my favourite attraction in Rome. The whistling of the security also seemed to be at its most prevalent here as well even compared to the Trevi Fountain, there were a lot of confused faces from people attempting to sit on the steps and having whistles blown at them!

title: A shock to the senses
text: As a huge fan Roman mythology the Trevi Fountain was always high on my list of must sees if i ever travelled to Rome but it is so much bigger and more impressive in person than it appears on film or in pictures. It almost sneaks up on you as you enter the square from a small side street to be presented by this huge construction that is just breathtaking! It is of course very busy and security use their whistles liberally to remind tourists not to sit on the edge, dip their hands in the water etc. A must see!

title: Like being in a movie
text: After a fairly hefty walk trying to find this square (our fault not Rome's) we entered the area and immediatley got the sense that this is the Rome you see in films! Surrounded by restaurants and balconies adorned with foliage, thousands of tourists and a wonderful fountain of the god Neptune this was how you imagine Rome to be. We were warned against pickpockets in this area but there is a high security presence and unlike some of the other areas we weren't harassed by street vendors or the like. A must see if in Rome.

title: Beautiful and Majestic
text: Simply the views from atop the hill are worth the trip in alone but then when presented with the historical ruins, beautiful gardens and impressive fountains as well it makes the trip even more rewarding. Once again the free drinking water came in handy as it was a very hot and dusty experience. Note that some areas require a further ticket to enter so check what your admission ticket allows before visiting.

title: A hot and historical wander!
text: The forum is so grand and so varied in its remains but you really get a sense of this as a once bustling community centre as you walk around the various ruins. I felt like there could be more in the way of descriptive placards and whilst there is some they are not overly detailed, maybe a tour guide would be a better option than doing it alone like we did. It is very open and therefore very hot but there are the free water fountains around and some trees to shade under near the opening of the Forum. Well worth a visit.

title: I was entertained!
text: My excitement at simply seeing the Colosseum when driving past was palpable but my experience visiting it topped that feeling. The sheer size and enormity of the structure and the knowledge that it has withstood centuries fills you with wonder. There are plenty of placards around explaining various elements of the structure and its history and i certainly learnt a lot in the concourse museum style areas as well. The fact that admission is limited means that it never really feels crowded but my recommendation would be to buy the skip the queue tickets online before you travel as we walked pretty much straight in whilst others melted in the heat whilst waiting. There is a lot of work taking place at the moment so some areas are not open to the public and i feel a visit in the future will be necessary so i can see the underneath areas too.

title: A magical merging of different cultures
text: From the front this imposing structure is a wonderful demonstration of Greek style architecture but when inside it becomes a symbol of the Christian faith and equally impressive. look up to the roof to see the opening that at the right times of day is beautiful in itself. A wonderful, historical building.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Booked this hotel for a slightly last minute city break in the summer and was really happy that we did. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable, staff are friendly, helpful and speak excellent English (important for us as ignorantly speak very little Italian!) The gym was adequate for a few nights away just to keep your hand in and the rooftop pool area is lovely after a morning of sight seeing in the very hot and dusty city. A word of caution with the pool which i wish id known before travelling though is that you are required to wear a swimming cap and they are quite strict with this. They are available to buy at the hotel but if you have one take it with you. We didn't eat at the hotel but the food certainly looks high quality and whilst there is a large selection of drinks at the bar they were quite expensive.The hotel is quite far out from the main attractions of Rome and you must use public transport to access them, this can be quite confusing to start with in the sense that the bus tickets are purchased from local newsagents and tobacco shops as opposed to on the bus themselves and you have to remember to scan them when you get on the bus. The route in to the city itself is about 20 minutes and the busses go regularly from very early in the morning to quite late in the evening. Once we got our bearings this was no problem and the hotel more than suited our needs for this wonderful stay.

title: Fantastic Anniversary Treat
text: My wife treated me to a meal here in July (on the hottest day of the year!!!) and we had a wonderful three course meal that was presented as you would expect at a restaurant with this reputation and tasted superb. We sampled some of the cocktails beforehand as well that were on and these were delicious, reasonably priced and quite strong. The decor and the service are top notch and my only "complaint" on this particular day was that there didnt seem to be any air conditioning, i may be wrong due to extreme city temperature that was going on outside but either way i was very warm. Excellent treat and will definitely come back!

title: Great Aquarium
text: Upon entering the very beautiful 1920s style building you get the sense that this is going to be a small aquarium but as you continue to move through it is surprisingly large and has a variety of species to wonder at. It is a beautiful well kept aquarium and when we visited in June it was quiet and you could take your time observing the creatures not feeling rushed or pushed out of the way like we have experienced at some venues. I would definitely visit again.

title: A Mythical Visit
text: This is both an amazing example of the beauty of nature but also a trip in to Greek history and mythology. The climb up is quite taxing actually particularly depending on the heat but once you arrive at the cave it is well worth it. The descent down in to the cave is awe inspiring and you can really see why the ancients viewed this as a place of mythology and spiritual importance. Once back down the hill there are plenty of little tourist shops and places to eat and drink. Well worth the jaunt up the hill, wear good shoes!

title: Lovely modern bar
text: We took a walk to this bar specifically on the recommendation of some friends from our hotel who raved about the food and drinks here. We weren't disappointed. The staff were incredibly welcoming and actually apologised that they hadn't been able to spend more time talking with us as they were so busy. There was an ample selection of drinks and the gin selection was particularly impressive. Big screen TVs showing sport were on as was decent music selection.

title: Great fun holiday pub
text: Well aside from the fact that this pub was seemingly made for me, pirate themed, Guinness on tap, next to the sea, live music, quizzes (it literally is the pub i would open!) it still impressed us every visit. The fact that the pub was situated so close to our hotel was a bonus but i think if we had been staying further away we would have still waked to go here as it was just always so fun. Staff are great, have fabulous senses of humour and were welcoming every visit. Drinks are reasonably priced (even the dreaded imported Guinness wasn't too expensive) and there was plenty of choice depending on your mood. The quiz nights are a great laugh and are well ran with some generous prizes. As mentioned before the location was actually breathtaking and the breeze near the sea was welcomed after some very hot days. I would happily go back to Sissi just to go back to this pub but luckily the rest of Sissi is great too.

title: Great location and great price
text: This was a lovely bar with a lovely seating area that overlooked the very picturesque harbour area. Drinks were reasonably priced and they had a good choice and the general atmosphere was welcoming and friendly, staff were lovely.

title: Excellent Helpful Staff
text: We booked our trip to Zeus' cave using this agent and the lady who served us was very polite, courteous and helpful and never once seemed to rush us, she answered all our questions and made her own recommendations to us as well.

title: A lovely well cared for beach
text: The beach is situated in a little almost private cove area and is serviced by a large takeaway/bar/club area that i think must stay open in to the night as a beach bar. There are plenty of sunbeds available but i think you have to pay for them. The sea and beach is clean and perfect for swimming and playing.

title: The most difficult mini gold course ever!
text: This is a great mini golf course and a fantastic way to lose a few hours in a fun fashion. The fact that they serve drinks is a bonus so you can really enjoy your round on what i feel is the hardest mini golf course i have ever played on. Well worth a visit and the sunset bar area at the front was a great place to see the sunset.

title: Holiday from Heaven
text: This was a beautiful hotel, scenic and relaxing, well maintained and offering exemplary customer service in all areas. The restaurant is five star and the food choices are vast, the waiting staff are all great and we particularly enjoyed our chats with Stavros on a nightly basis. The rooms are immaculate and staff bring water and chocolates to your room every evening as well. When there is entertainment provided it is high quality and enjoyable and the quiz/karaoke night was a particular favourite of ours. The hotels location is ideal to be able to wander around the village or down to the seafront as well as over to the restaurants and bars. We really cant praise this hotel enough and we had the relaxing and fun holiday we had been looking forward to so much. My only recommendations for improvement would be more weight machines or dumbbells in the gym and also some AC in the gym as it is warm whenever you go in, we also felt there could be more evenings of entertainment as this would have made us stay in the hotel more rather than using local pubs etc.

title: Still the best!
text: When we unexpectedly booked a last minute holiday to Costa Teguise the one thing i demanded that we do was visit Jesters again and i wasn't let down. Still full of charm and good fun it really is the best bar around. The staff are so friendly and even remembered us from 5 years ago and we immediately felt welcome. Everyone seems to be having a good time and the atmosphere just helps you as an individual to get more involved and have a great night. I dont know how the staff have the energy to do this every night but they do and they are a credit to the establishment. Hope to visit again sooner than another 5 years!

title: What an Addition!
text: Stumbled upon this great bar when heading for a regular Costa Teguise Karaoke venue and thought we would pop in and give it a try and we were so glad that we did. The venue is modern and comfortable and has a good range of reasonably priced drinks. It appears as if there is live entertainment every night and the two nights we visited we were very impressed with the quality of the acts. This venue is a real boost to the town and one we will definitely visit again on our return to the area,

title: Excellent Family Hotel
text: Recently visited during the potentially busy half term week and was a little wary as haven't done a family hotel for very long time. Dropped off after the very short transfer from the airport and the exterior and lobby area are all impressive and welcoming, our room wasn't quite ready yet but we were given our wristbands so could get a drink and something to eat whilst we waited. When the room was ready we were pleased with it as we had a lovely view of the sea and the room is clean and comfortable. It is fairly basic but there is a fridge for drinks and a TV and the beds are clean so what more do you need. The pools and surrounding area are clean and well kept and it was fairly easy to get beds though some do reserve them very early in the morning it seemed The food was great and there was a good variety available at all three sittings. Staff work hard and are friendly and welcoming but we felt the dining room may benefit from guests being seated as it is a bit of a free for all and staff have to work extra hard to get tables cleared. The entertainments team were great and there seemed to be a lot on offer for all ages. In the evening the bar queue can sometimes get a little long but it does die down when the children's entertainment finishes and there are more tables and chairs available then too. The gym is pretty basic particularly for those who like to lift weights but the cable machine and the dumbbells were sufficient to keep your hand in for a weeks break.The town is about a 30minute walk along the coast or down the road and we ventured in twice during the week and got a taxi back which was under 5 euro. All in all we were really happy with our break and would definitely return particularly with a family as the facilities for children seemed great.

title: Easter Special
text: Now that I have the membership here I think our visits will become more and more regular and over the Eater weekend we took our nephews and once again had a new experience. The school lesson is fascinating and funny, the little cinema is informative and atmospheric and the coal mine experience is immersive. The staff here seem to really enjoy their jobs and I often leave wishing I could join them. If you are a fan of peaky blinders then the points of interest are numerous. A great day out.

title: Broad Range of Animals
text: We visited the zoo in the holidays to actually take part in one of their keeper programs with the orang-utans which was absolutely incredible but aside from that 45 minute experience we visited the zoo as regular visitors. I was shocked at the range of animals that are present here and how up close you can get to a lot of them. The animals seem happy and well cared for and whilst some of the décor is dated there is obvious updating going on around the zoo as evidenced by the new habitats for the chimpanzees and the fundraising for the new orang-utan habitat as well. The zoo is reasonably priced and very family friendly and we will most definitely be returning to visit our orang-utan friends.

title: Always a Lovely Mean in an Even Lovlier Atmosphere
text: Visited on a few occasions, usualy for special occasions like birthdays and we have always had a lovely meal whic has been prepared in a timely fashion and served by friendly and accommodating staff. The building itself is very nice and the inside décor is old country pub style, low beams and the like, which is very inviting and cosy. A lovely restaurant.

title: Wondeful food and sevice
text: Visited recently because of an excellent Groupon voucher but following a lovely meal that was served with great pride from the staff in a timely and friendly fashion we will definitely be returning. The food is gorgeous and the portions are excellent which I have found to be an issue sometimes with eat in Chinese restaurants. Drinks are reasonably priced and there are a variety of drink options available. The restaurant is spacious and clean and the décor is inviting. A lovely evening!

title: Old School Cool Pub
text: Visited a few times recently usually on a Friday evening following the local basketball games. This is a great pub with a cool, laid back atmosphere. Drinks are a reasonable price for a city centre pub and quirky little features like the record player are an excellent addition. Staff are great and give you a warm welcome every visit. Well worth a visit.

title: Meat Heaven
text: Have visited Ounce a couple of times over the past few months and taken advantage of the pound an ounce steak offer. The service is excellent and considering how busy the restaurant has been on every occasion we have visited the quickness of service is to be commended. The food is beautiful and the steak which is the speciality has been perfect on every visit. If the restaurant ever needs a taste tester I would be more than happy to apply, keep up the good work.

title: Check it out Arthur is Talking to the Fish
text: Having recently watched the Aquaman movie we were inspired to visit the local Sealife Centre which coincidentally enough was running competitions linked with the film. This is a good hour to an hour and a half activity and there is plenty to see, if you read all the information it would take you longer. We visited during the tail end of the Xmas holidays and it was busy with children which is to be expected. There is currently building work going on but we were given a free return ticket so I think this may have been in compensation for that slight upheaval. It is a lovely attraction and the tunnel towards the end is just magical.

title: Good but not perfect
text: Visited just before Xmas and was impressed by the décor and the layout of the restaurant. The menu was vast and the prices seemed cheap for the portions we were seeing coming out. Ordered our drinks and food and then unfortunately had quite a long wait that required us going back up to the bar to check if we had been forgotten. It didn't seem too busy so this was a little worrying. When our food did arrive it was lovely and well worth the price and we took a dessert to go which was unbelievably big. We enjoyed the meal and the service was polite our only concern was the plus 30 minutes wait that we had.

title: An enjoyable drink or five!
text: We visited the pub after having a wander round Harrods and my trusty Google maps suggested this as a local pub to the shop. We found the atmosphere in the pub to be great, staff were friendly and chatty and the Guinness was a good pint. We both enjoyed ourselves sat in the window watching the world go by very much.

title: Amazing Views of the City
text: I wasn't sure what to expect when my wife booked this attraction but it is worth it for the views of the city. Unfortunately we went on a rainy and windy day so the outside balcony was closed which was a disappointment to say the least but the views from inside are still fantastic. The actual sky garden itself is also impressive and worth visiting.

title: Fantastic food and service!
text: We stumbled upon this little restaurant by accident really. We were wandering around Kensington looking for food and we particularly had a hankering for Italian. Luckily I spotted an Italian flag flying outside so we headed towards the restaurant and the menu looked great so we went in and we were both so happy that we did. The food was delicious, fresh and cooked to perfection and each course was served with a smile. We were also incredibly pleased with the reasonable prices as having looked at menus in the windows of some of the other restaurants nearby we would have ended up paying a lot more. A real gem of a find!

title: Ideal for a short break in London
text: I booked this hotel due to its relatively close proximity to the Olympia as we were attending the London Film and Comicon on the Saturday so we thought we may as well make a weekend out of it. The first thing that struck me about the hotel is its proximity to the tube station which is a real bonus when jumping on and off with luggage or when needing to get on to visit other areas of the city. Secondly the location in relation to Kensington High Street is great so you are able to walk to get food or go to the shops. The hotel itself was comfortable and luckily the air con in the rooms was great as we visited during some very warm days in July. Our only issue with the hotel was with the lifts that seem to have a mind of their own and take forever at certain times of the day. The gym was adequate for a hotel as well.

title: "I thought you'd be bigger!"
text: This was genuinely one of the best bars I have ever visited, anywhere! The staff are welcoming and fun, the live band was fantastic and the general atmosphere in the place was upbeat and happy go lucky. good selection of Beers although the imports are a little pricey as to be expected but general drinks prices are reasonable. The décor is cool and the little nods to the movie Roadhouse made me really happy! The only problem was that we didn't find it until two nights before the end of our holiday as I would have been in here every night had I known about it earlier. A great place and will definitely visit again.

title: A Historical Masterpiece
text: I felt so honoured to be able to walk around the Acropolis here in Lindos and you really felt a sense of the importance that this site has had throughout history and the various occupations of this island. Wear your trainers or walking shoes as flip flops wont cut it!

title: Stunning Location
text: We took the boat cruise from Rhodes Town to arrive at Lindos and spent a few hours here. It was beautiful pulling in to the harbour and seeing the white buildings and the Acropolis looming over the bay. The bay itself was incredibly busy because of all the boats that pull up but the water is clear and there are many fish swimming around to look upon if you don't mind sharing the ocean with them. The trek up to the Acropolis is hard work because of the steep gradient, slippery cobbles and mainly the intense heat but when you do arrive pay the 12 Euro entrance as the Acropolis itself and the views are just breath-taking and it really made me feel like id experienced part of Ancient Greece when we visited. Well worth the trek and you feel good about not subjecting a donkey to me putting 17 stone on his back!

title: Wow!
text: Where to start with this review. It is very rare that we return to same destination twice but we have already started looking to return to this tremendous hotel. Our room on the ground floor near the main lobby was beautiful and comfortable, cleaned daily and a very comfortable temperature after a hot day by the pool. We never struggled to get a sun lounger either on the beach or by the pool whatever time of day we got there which is amazing considering the size of the hotel. The meals in the main restaurant were delicious and the daily themes kept things fresh. The décor of the hotel makes you feel like you are somewhere special and really has that wow factor when you walk in. Now on to the major selling point for us which is the staff, we came across so many wonderful staff that work here that there are too many to mention but we must mention the pool bar staff in particular including George, Stelios, Yanis and Anneta! They could not have made us feel more welcome, this goes for the greeters and the table staff in the dining hall as well, every day it was like they were seeing a long lost friend. The concierge and the gentleman that runs the onsite jewellery shop also deserve recognition. My only recommendation would be to increase the equipment in the gym. There is plenty of floor space for more machinery or free weights in the gym and it would just make it easier to use at busy periods. What a holiday!!!!
place: The Ixian Grand Adults Only Hotel

title: Like Being in a Film Set
text: I truly could not believe how well preserved the Medieval aspects of Rhodes were, it was amazing to walk around and see the architecture and get a real sense of the history of the city. It is incredibly busy here and very easy to get confused as to what direction you are heading but well worth your time to visit.

title: Like walking back in time!
text: I loved the stadium in Rhodes, I am a huge fan of Greek History and to see a stadium like this in person was an amazing experience. We used the hop on hop off bus to get here and stayed for about an hour which was plenty, when we arrived it was quiet but suddenly three tour busses arrived which did effect the enjoyment we had been experiencing as it suddenly became very loud and difficult to take pictures etc.

title: Great to see in person
text: I was excited to see the Acropolis and whilst it is magnificent to see in person it was disappointing due to the level of scaffolding currently surrounding the remaining pillars. Still its worth visiting for the views and its proximity to the ancient stadium mean you can fit both in under an hour.

title: An interesting and picturesque walk
text: The walls boast some lovely walks around that give you a great view in to the castle and the beautiful surroundings of the castle as well. Some of the steps can be a little small and difficult to climb.

title: A long day but well worth it!
text: Many of the reviews here complain about the length of time spent at the Canyon in relation to the amount of time spent on the coach and whilst the journey is a long one it would also be long if you decided to drive from Vegas and back yourselves in a day to the South Rim. The fact that our coach driver was so knowledgeable about a multitude of areas on the journey added to the experience I felt and provided me with a guided tour of the very interesting landscape en route to the destination. The Canyon itself needs no review as it is simple breath-taking. The two stops on the way were welcome inclusions at the relevant stages of the journey and the buffet lunch was perfectly adequate for the cost providing a good choice and pretty quick service. I actually appreciated the various films and videos shown on the coach as I felt it made the trip go quicker particularly on the way back.

title: Belly Busting Brilliance
text: The first time in a long time that I had felt seriously beaten by a meal once id finished it. There was a little bit of a wait for a table but the Atlantis show is just outside so that killed some time as did a wander round the shops nearby. Once inside the atmosphere was great and our server was wonderful. The food was delicious and reasonably priced with an excellent portion size, I forced myself to have a cheesecake as ive visited before and not had one which seems silly considering the name of the restaurant. It was delicious and I swear my wife became emotional with joy over her selection. Will be happy to visit again.

title: Better than Expected
text: From reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I must admit to being a little concerned that id booked a dud for our recent trip to Vegas. Having been to Vegas before and having the privilege of staying in some of the top resorts I was aware that the price paid for this stay would be reflected in the differences between say the Venetian and here. What I can now say is that we were pleasantly surprised by the Excalibur and had no complaints over our 5 day stay at the resort. Check in was quick and painless and whilst we arrived way too early for our room we were able to leave our bags with some incredibly helpful staff. Staff around the resort greeted us always with enthusiasm and a smile and are a credit to the resort. Our room was clean, comfortable ad had a great view of the strip including New York New York and the MGM Grand. The gym facilities were excellent and the equipment was modern and in a nice setting overlooking the pool in the hotels spa. The food court had a great choice of dining options meaning you didn't need to leave the resort to find that breakfast muffin or late evening chicken dish you need. The buffet was excellent and we benefited from some vouchers from the MLife rewards program, without these it may be considered a little pricey. The various bars in the resort were great, staffed by friendly knowledgeable bartenders and I personally enjoyed the karaoke night at the lounge. The pool is well staffed and clean and sun loungers were relatively easy to come by depending on what time of day you arrived to the area. We would certainly stay at the Excalibur again and it is ideal if you're looking for a less expensive but still authentic Vegas experience.

title: Wondeful food and sevice
text: Visited recently because of an excellent Groupon voucher but following a lovely meal that was served with great pride from the staff in a timely and friendly fashion we will definitely be returning. The food is gorgeous and the portions are excellent which I have found to be an issue sometimes with eat in Chinese restaurants. Drinks are reasonably priced and there are a variety of drink options available. The restaurant is spacious and clean and the décor is inviting. A lovely evening!

title: Old School Cool Pub
text: Visited a few times recently usually on a Friday evening following the local basketball games. This is a great pub with a cool, laid back atmosphere. Drinks are a reasonable price for a city centre pub and quirky little features like the record player are an excellent addition. Staff are great and give you a warm welcome every visit. Well worth a visit.

title: Meat Heaven
text: Have visited Ounce a couple of times over the past few months and taken advantage of the pound an ounce steak offer. The service is excellent and considering how busy the restaurant has been on every occasion we have visited the quickness of service is to be commended. The food is beautiful and the steak which is the speciality has been perfect on every visit. If the restaurant ever needs a taste tester I would be more than happy to apply, keep up the good work.

title: Check it out Arthur is Talking to the Fish
text: Having recently watched the Aquaman movie we were inspired to visit the local Sealife Centre which coincidentally enough was running competitions linked with the film. This is a good hour to an hour and a half activity and there is plenty to see, if you read all the information it would take you longer. We visited during the tail end of the Xmas holidays and it was busy with children which is to be expected. There is currently building work going on but we were given a free return ticket so I think this may have been in compensation for that slight upheaval. It is a lovely attraction and the tunnel towards the end is just magical.

title: Good but not perfect
text: Visited just before Xmas and was impressed by the décor and the layout of the restaurant. The menu was vast and the prices seemed cheap for the portions we were seeing coming out. Ordered our drinks and food and then unfortunately had quite a long wait that required us going back up to the bar to check if we had been forgotten. It didn't seem too busy so this was a little worrying. When our food did arrive it was lovely and well worth the price and we took a dessert to go which was unbelievably big. We enjoyed the meal and the service was polite our only concern was the plus 30 minutes wait that we had.

title: An enjoyable drink or five!
text: We visited the pub after having a wander round Harrods and my trusty Google maps suggested this as a local pub to the shop. We found the atmosphere in the pub to be great, staff were friendly and chatty and the Guinness was a good pint. We both enjoyed ourselves sat in the window watching the world go by very much.

title: Amazing Views of the City
text: I wasn't sure what to expect when my wife booked this attraction but it is worth it for the views of the city. Unfortunately we went on a rainy and windy day so the outside balcony was closed which was a disappointment to say the least but the views from inside are still fantastic. The actual sky garden itself is also impressive and worth visiting.

title: Fantastic food and service!
text: We stumbled upon this little restaurant by accident really. We were wandering around Kensington looking for food and we particularly had a hankering for Italian. Luckily I spotted an Italian flag flying outside so we headed towards the restaurant and the menu looked great so we went in and we were both so happy that we did. The food was delicious, fresh and cooked to perfection and each course was served with a smile. We were also incredibly pleased with the reasonable prices as having looked at menus in the windows of some of the other restaurants nearby we would have ended up paying a lot more. A real gem of a find!

title: Ideal for a short break in London
text: I booked this hotel due to its relatively close proximity to the Olympia as we were attending the London Film and Comicon on the Saturday so we thought we may as well make a weekend out of it. The first thing that struck me about the hotel is its proximity to the tube station which is a real bonus when jumping on and off with luggage or when needing to get on to visit other areas of the city. Secondly the location in relation to Kensington High Street is great so you are able to walk to get food or go to the shops. The hotel itself was comfortable and luckily the air con in the rooms was great as we visited during some very warm days in July. Our only issue with the hotel was with the lifts that seem to have a mind of their own and take forever at certain times of the day. The gym was adequate for a hotel as well.

title: "I thought you'd be bigger!"
text: This was genuinely one of the best bars I have ever visited, anywhere! The staff are welcoming and fun, the live band was fantastic and the general atmosphere in the place was upbeat and happy go lucky. good selection of Beers although the imports are a little pricey as to be expected but general drinks prices are reasonable. The décor is cool and the little nods to the movie Roadhouse made me really happy! The only problem was that we didn't find it until two nights before the end of our holiday as I would have been in here every night had I known about it earlier. A great place and will definitely visit again.

title: A Historical Masterpiece
text: I felt so honoured to be able to walk around the Acropolis here in Lindos and you really felt a sense of the importance that this site has had throughout history and the various occupations of this island. Wear your trainers or walking shoes as flip flops wont cut it!

title: Stunning Location
text: We took the boat cruise from Rhodes Town to arrive at Lindos and spent a few hours here. It was beautiful pulling in to the harbour and seeing the white buildings and the Acropolis looming over the bay. The bay itself was incredibly busy because of all the boats that pull up but the water is clear and there are many fish swimming around to look upon if you don't mind sharing the ocean with them. The trek up to the Acropolis is hard work because of the steep gradient, slippery cobbles and mainly the intense heat but when you do arrive pay the 12 Euro entrance as the Acropolis itself and the views are just breath-taking and it really made me feel like id experienced part of Ancient Greece when we visited. Well worth the trek and you feel good about not subjecting a donkey to me putting 17 stone on his back!

title: Wow!
text: Where to start with this review. It is very rare that we return to same destination twice but we have already started looking to return to this tremendous hotel. Our room on the ground floor near the main lobby was beautiful and comfortable, cleaned daily and a very comfortable temperature after a hot day by the pool. We never struggled to get a sun lounger either on the beach or by the pool whatever time of day we got there which is amazing considering the size of the hotel. The meals in the main restaurant were delicious and the daily themes kept things fresh. The décor of the hotel makes you feel like you are somewhere special and really has that wow factor when you walk in. Now on to the major selling point for us which is the staff, we came across so many wonderful staff that work here that there are too many to mention but we must mention the pool bar staff in particular including George, Stelios, Yanis and Anneta! They could not have made us feel more welcome, this goes for the greeters and the table staff in the dining hall as well, every day it was like they were seeing a long lost friend. The concierge and the gentleman that runs the onsite jewellery shop also deserve recognition. My only recommendation would be to increase the equipment in the gym. There is plenty of floor space for more machinery or free weights in the gym and it would just make it easier to use at busy periods. What a holiday!!!!
place: The Ixian Grand Adults Only Hotel

title: Like Being in a Film Set
text: I truly could not believe how well preserved the Medieval aspects of Rhodes were, it was amazing to walk around and see the architecture and get a real sense of the history of the city. It is incredibly busy here and very easy to get confused as to what direction you are heading but well worth your time to visit.

title: Like walking back in time!
text: I loved the stadium in Rhodes, I am a huge fan of Greek History and to see a stadium like this in person was an amazing experience. We used the hop on hop off bus to get here and stayed for about an hour which was plenty, when we arrived it was quiet but suddenly three tour busses arrived which did effect the enjoyment we had been experiencing as it suddenly became very loud and difficult to take pictures etc.

title: Great to see in person
text: I was excited to see the Acropolis and whilst it is magnificent to see in person it was disappointing due to the level of scaffolding currently surrounding the remaining pillars. Still its worth visiting for the views and its proximity to the ancient stadium mean you can fit both in under an hour.

title: An interesting and picturesque walk
text: The walls boast some lovely walks around that give you a great view in to the castle and the beautiful surroundings of the castle as well. Some of the steps can be a little small and difficult to climb.

title: A long day but well worth it!
text: Many of the reviews here complain about the length of time spent at the Canyon in relation to the amount of time spent on the coach and whilst the journey is a long one it would also be long if you decided to drive from Vegas and back yourselves in a day to the South Rim. The fact that our coach driver was so knowledgeable about a multitude of areas on the journey added to the experience I felt and provided me with a guided tour of the very interesting landscape en route to the destination. The Canyon itself needs no review as it is simple breath-taking. The two stops on the way were welcome inclusions at the relevant stages of the journey and the buffet lunch was perfectly adequate for the cost providing a good choice and pretty quick service. I actually appreciated the various films and videos shown on the coach as I felt it made the trip go quicker particularly on the way back.

title: Belly Busting Brilliance
text: The first time in a long time that I had felt seriously beaten by a meal once id finished it. There was a little bit of a wait for a table but the Atlantis show is just outside so that killed some time as did a wander round the shops nearby. Once inside the atmosphere was great and our server was wonderful. The food was delicious and reasonably priced with an excellent portion size, I forced myself to have a cheesecake as ive visited before and not had one which seems silly considering the name of the restaurant. It was delicious and I swear my wife became emotional with joy over her selection. Will be happy to visit again.

title: Better than Expected
text: From reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I must admit to being a little concerned that id booked a dud for our recent trip to Vegas. Having been to Vegas before and having the privilege of staying in some of the top resorts I was aware that the price paid for this stay would be reflected in the differences between say the Venetian and here. What I can now say is that we were pleasantly surprised by the Excalibur and had no complaints over our 5 day stay at the resort. Check in was quick and painless and whilst we arrived way too early for our room we were able to leave our bags with some incredibly helpful staff. Staff around the resort greeted us always with enthusiasm and a smile and are a credit to the resort. Our room was clean, comfortable ad had a great view of the strip including New York New York and the MGM Grand. The gym facilities were excellent and the equipment was modern and in a nice setting overlooking the pool in the hotels spa. The food court had a great choice of dining options meaning you didn't need to leave the resort to find that breakfast muffin or late evening chicken dish you need. The buffet was excellent and we benefited from some vouchers from the MLife rewards program, without these it may be considered a little pricey. The various bars in the resort were great, staffed by friendly knowledgeable bartenders and I personally enjoyed the karaoke night at the lounge. The pool is well staffed and clean and sun loungers were relatively easy to come by depending on what time of day you arrived to the area. We would certainly stay at the Excalibur again and it is ideal if you're looking for a less expensive but still authentic Vegas experience.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: The hotel is in a fantastic location for exploring downtown and having accessibility to the BART and the cable cars to get around to some of the tourist destinations and the airport. As well as that it is conveniently located near Union Square and all the restaurants, shops and attractions. The staff were fantastic here giving you a warm welcome every time you walked through the door or out of the lift. My wife particularly enjoyed the complimentary champagne provided for a few hours early evening. The rooms were clean and comfortable and plenty big enough for a city break and the gym was surprisingly well equipped for a small hotel gym we found we were able to have a decent workout. The only downside to the hotel is the level of noise at night outside BUT it is to be expected in a busy city centre location like this. We would definitely stay again.

title: An exhausting but breath-taking bike ride
text: We chose to hire bikes to ride across the bridge and back and whilst I was exhausted after the 10 mile round trip the 2 miles of the bridge itself are breath-taking in terms of the views and also the adrenaline rush of the being so high on such a busy bridge. Bikes are separated from the main traffic so there is no concern there but there were some "pro bikers" that can be a little intimidating as they whizz past you. The ride to and from the bridge is also incredible with scenery you cant describe and it was well worth the pain of the bike ride to see it.

title: An atmospheric experience like no other!
text: Alcatraz impressed on so many levels and it was lovely to learn that the island was more than just a top security prison. The audio guide tour really immerses you in the stories of the prison both its inmates and its staff and they have done a really good job in leaving the island untouched and as it was as opposed to making it tourist friendly. I was amazed at the additional things I learnt about the island and left with a sense of awe and wonder about the place. The ferry trip over gives you some fantastic views of the city and the bridges and is a great experience. A must do if in the Bay Area.

title: A fun way to get around
text: Just being on the cars is an experience in itself and after walking up some of the hills they travel up and down a necessary one if you want to save your legs. The cond. The conductors all seemed lively and fun and as though they enjoyed their jobs and they make the journeys an even better experience. The lines to get on down by the ticket office were really long so I suggest walking up the hill a little to get on.

title: Tourists Dream
text: Only spent an afternoon here but there was plenty to see and do and eat for much longer visits. Obviously a very tourist driven area but sometimes that what you want and need. The sealions are wonderful to watch and you could spend all day just doing that im sure. Great shops for your tourist gifts and actually found them to be reasonably priced as well as were the restaurants etc.

title: Scenic and bustling
text: A great location and easy to get to using the cable cars there are a great selection of restaurants and attractions with beautiful views of the Golden Gate bridge and the coast in general. We hardly scratched the surface of what there was here to do in an afternoon so you could probably make a day of it. We hired our bikes for the Golden Gate bridge ride from here but bear in mind it is 3 miles still to the bridge and a lot of that is uphill.

title: Great Views and Great Staff
text: The views from the top of Mount Diablo are breath-taking being able to see San Francisco the sea one way and the snow capped mountains the other way it was just spectacular. The staff at the gift shop and the rangers were all incredibly friendly and helpful and really seemed to love their park. You need to be a confident driver to handle the roads up and being aware of the cyclists is a must as there seems to be a lot of them and they seem to have no concern for their own well-being.

title: Comfortable, reasonably priced short stay
text: Visited during half term holidays and spent 3 nights here. Was really pleased with the room and whilst the TV wasn't working when we arrived they sorted it within ten minutes. The fitness suite is great as far as hotel gyms go and the pool area looked lovely. The benefit of staying here is also the location of the park and ride which gets you in to Chester cheaply and regularly and is located literally next to the hotel. The hotel is old fashioned in some areas but appears to be undergoing modernisation and the entrance area, bar and function areas are all modern and new looking. There is a nice pub/restaurant over the road that is Harvester like but not and there are takeaways and shops a 5 minute ride away in the car. Ideal location for driving to the zoo as well.

title: A Lovely Way to Spend a Day
text: Having visited San Diego Zoo I always have high expectations of these kinds of attractions and Chester Zoo did not disappoint. A day here easily flew by with the number of attractions available and an incredibly wide array of animals all seemingly happy and cared for and enjoying their lives at the zoo. The new area with the boat ride and the indoor orang-utan viewing area is really well done and very American theme park influenced. We truly enjoyed our day here immensely.

title: Beautiful Visit in to a Historical Place
text: A really beautiful cathedral that is jam packed with history and things to look at. Id say that you can do this fully in an hour or so but there is a gift shop and café if you wanted to make it a longer visit.

title: Walking in the steps of the Romans
text: I love attractions like this and you really get a sense of the scale of the walls and their usage over periods of history. There are signs around explaining key areas and points of history but aside from that the views across the river and around the city are worth walking the walls for alone.

title: A samll glimpse of a Roman Way of Life
text: Whilst the gardens are only small they are incredibly beautiful and informative as well. I was delighted to hear a parent explaining to his young daughter how the under floor heating would have worked and the little girl was able to go up to the remains of the system and see the various elements her dad was explaining. I can imagine that in the summer this area is even more attractive to tourists as it allows an area to sit in a picturesque environment.

title: Great View
text: Worth having a walk across for the scenic views down the river in both directions. We walked across on a very windy way which was interesting.

title: FINALLY i got to the home of Guinness
text: After 5 previous visits to Dublin including one where we stayed in an Air bnb directly behind the storehouse and after keeping Guinness in business for about 4 years I finally got to visit the home of my favourite tipple. We used the Dublin Pass for entry and I can honestly say that this along with the bus rides, 4 other attractions visited, airport coach and free Irish coffee in a restaurant, was the most cost effective way of spending a weekend in Dublin and getting to visit the storehouse. The attraction is very entertaining and I enjoyed every floor of the experience from start to finish. Staff are friendly and seem to really enjoy their jobs. The bar is reasonably priced which shocked me with it being smack back in a tourist attraction. When we visited the gift shop again we were pleasantly shocked at the reasonable and realistic prices for the items available as well as the huge range to suit all ages. We spent around 3 hours here but you could definitely stay longer with some of the bar areas being very inviting for a few drinks, or ten! Ive found my spirit home!

title: Great fun but very pricey and very crowded
text: Temple Bar is a must see for your trip to Dublin but we found on this occasion, our 6th trip here, that actually the beer is overpriced compared to what you can get in pubs a few streets away, and that it was incredibly busy in the bars. There are tons of stag and hen parties around and you are ensured a lively night out but maybe im getting old as I preferred a sit down in a bar listening to some good music. Still its well worth a visit and definitely a must for those seeking lively nightlife.

title: A Great Visit for a Viking Wannabee
text: Love this attraction. Great for adults, families, school parties you name it. There are some great stories to be told by this attraction and they do it really well. A new experience for us on this visit was a walk up the tower to a sensational view of the city and whilst our thighs sieves up by the bottom steps it was well worth the jaunt.

title: A historic jump across the Liffey
text: A picturesque way to cross the river and a nice way to see down both ways. Also nice to see the various padlocks attached and the words inscrolled on them.

title: Loved this Attraction
text: Whilst this tour is much smaller than the Guinness factory it was still full of fun. the tour guides are passionate and knowledgeable and the taste testing provided us with an ample amount of whiskey to sample. the bar area was really fun as well and had a great atmosphere. Drinks were reasonably priced as well which was surprising considering the level of tourism associated with the venue. Would definitely visit again.

title: Irish food and plenty of it!
text: Convinced to go here by our American friend who proudly stated it was the only thing he had to do whilst we visited Dublin for a few days. We were not disappointed. The food was delicious, the drinks were as well. The price was reasonable and the service was supreme. An excellent experience for all of us in our party.

title: Expensive but delicious
text: First experience of a Five Guys and I can see what all the fuss is about. The quality of the food was incredible and the portion size of the fries even beat me which is rare!The milkshake was one of the best I've had for a long time and it was all topped off by a fantastic and friendly service from all the staff who genuinely seemed to enjoy their job!
